text:
hey everyone welcome to Pai's kitchen so today's 
recipe came out of my desire to find a quick and

healthy grab and go kind of breakfast because 
usually when I'm rushing out of the house I end

up at the coffee shop across the street and 
there's rarely anything that's both healthy

and delicious so I came across these muffins 
and I call them popeye muffins because they

are loaded with spinach but if you close your 
eyes and ate it you would never know they're

so yummy and so what I do is I stick them in the 
freezer and when I need to get out of the house

quick I throw them in the microwave 30 seconds 
and off I go and Adam actually loved these and

he insisted that I make a video for this recipe 
so if you like them you can thank him for that

let's get started super easy recipe so let's 
see with the dry ingredients first I've got

here some all-purpose flour and some wheat germ 
and wheat germ you can just buy at the grocery

store in the baking section it's basically the 
healthy part of the wheat kernel now you could

just use whole wheat flour but I actually prefer 
the flavor and the texture when I use white flour

and then just add the wheat germ now the wheat 
germ I toast it a little bit in a panel include

instructions in the written portion that's 
an optional step but I think at some nice

nutty flavor to this okay now I'm going to add 
some cinnamon for some extra flavor you don't

have to I mean you can really flavor this muffin 
however you'd like some leavening I've got baking

powder and baking soda which I'm going to sift 
into this because I have had in the past little

lumps of baking soda like baking soda always have 
tiny little lumps in it right and I got that in a

bite of something I had face and it was awful 
baking soda is gross now a little bit of salt

and just whisk everything together mmm the smell 
of cinnamon there's something about cinnamon and

breakfast and I like match made in heaven and 
that's it that's the dry ingredients now let's

deal with the wet ones wet ingredients are just 
as easy when you blitz everything in a blender

starting out with some yogurts so I love yogurt 
and quick breads just adds a nice tang I'm going

to also add my eggs some sugar and as you see 
there's only half a cup of sugar which is not

much at all for the batch that we're making so 
there's not a super-sweet recipe and some butter

now you could use a healthy oil like if you like 
avocado oil or whatever but you know what a little

butter doesn't hurt just FYI when you are blending 
always add your liquid ingredients first before

your dry ingredients like the spinach because 
if I put the spinach first at the very bottom

and then put a liquids on top it has a harder 
time spinning the blade now I'm going to season

this a little bit with some vanilla and now the 
spinach and if this whole thing of spinach is

going into the blender and in fact I may not even 
be able to fit it all in at once you can you can

put even more spinach in so this is 150 grams 
you can even do 175 I've done that before you

get an even more intense green let's just do that 
first and I'll put this after we've made some room

alright let's put some more spinach in mm look 
at that healthiness a buttery spinach smoothie

that should probably taste good on its own 
so now there's one more wet ingredient then

you could have blended but I prefer not to and 
that's bananas and this is why we can add less

sugar because we're adding some ripe bananas 
in it and I like to mash it because then when

you imagine you get like the tiny little lumps 
of banana and it's always a nice surprise and

you see that so I'm not gonna mash this overly 
finely send out the banana with the roux it's a

green liquid a little bit it just makes a banana a 
little easier to mix into the dry ingredients and

I think this just looks really awesome would be 
great for st. Patrick's Day ok so now we put the

wet into the dry and it's pretty much done into 
the middle mmm the banana give this a quick mix

now of course like with any muffin recipe you 
do not want to over mix this however because we

added the wheat germ there it's a little more 
forgiving because the wheat germ will act like

little blades and it prevents overdevelopment 
of gluten so you won't get those big holes that

you would if it were a regular white flour only 
muffin all right so now that it's sort of mix but

not really I'm going to add my add-ins which is my 
dry fruit and nut so I love things in my muffin I

don't like muffins that's got like one texture so 
I'm going to add some toasted pecans this came in

pieces already you can't walnuts or any kind of 
nuts that you like and also I'm going to add some

dried cherries and I like cherries because they're 
quite tart and quite moist but you can do chopped

apricots you can do dried blueberries anything 
that you'd like want to give these a big fold

see I don't like to mix everything well before 
adding the little bits because then you end up

over mixing it by the time you mix in a little bit 
scraping the bottom to make sure I don't have any

dry pockets of flour what's how cool this looks 
all right so I've got my muffin pans and muffin

liners so I do like to use liners just because it 
makes removing and cleaning easier but I like to

get one set of foil on the inside as opposed to 
just a paper one because these will not stick to

the muffin you know if it's a paper lining when 
you peel it you get quite a bit of muffin stuck

on the paper or these won't do that and it makes 
sure that these patterns stay nice and pretty

because the foil won't let the grease sort of seep 
through so I am using this Disher here this is a

size thirty I'm going to need mode one and a half 
for each muffin cup so now I'm going to garnish

these with some sliced bananas and I always like 
to put a little garnish on the muffin especially

when there's an ingredient you can't see just 
letting people know that hey there are bananas

in here and now to prevent the bananas from drying 
out in the oven I'm just going to brush them with

a little bit of melted butter now if you remember 
to not clean your butter bowl from earlier there's

usually enough to stuck around the bowl but you 
don't have to melt anymore all right and that's

it now these are going to go to a 375 degree 
fahrenheit oven for about 20 minutes or until

you put a toothpick in it becomes out Skene look 
at these it smells so good right now so as you

can see the bananas on top have been roasted in 
butter so you can just imagine how good that's

going to be so these are still a little hot oh 
look at that look how that the peels right off

and you don't get barely any muffin on the liner 
this is why I love these foil liner so much let

me show you the it's done whoo that's demon look 
how moist and delicious that looks you know what

this piece is good but I want to try the one 
with banana on it also good mmm-hmm this does

not feel like it should be healthy but as far 
as muffins Oh can't get much better than that

the tartness from the cherry and the crunchiness 
from the pecans work together really well and that

banana hmm and you just cannot help there's any 
vegetable of any sort in here at all and so you've

got kids and they don't like to eat vegetables 
they might think this is a cool green muffin so

the recipe as always will be on Pais kitchen calm 
when you make it I'd love to see it and send the

photos to me on Facebook Twitter or Instagram and 
I will see you next time for your next delicious
